subject: Re: JUnit-JPA (Hibernate) - Spring - Struts2 testing howto
msgSnippet: I did following: 1. Open Run configuration for BankServiceTest under Classpath - Bootstrap Entries - Add JAR s... 2. ...target/ /WEB-INF/lib
messageBody:
I did following:
1. Open "Run configuration" for BankServiceTest under
"Classpath"->"Bootstrap Entries"->Add JAR's...
2. ...target/<projectname>/WEB-INF/lib opens
3. I choose persistence-api-1.0.jar
4. Apply-Run

Hey, it works!!! But...

...you must admit that this is pretty ugly solution, because:

1. You need to add this persistance-api to every test class "Run
configuration"
2. Path to persistence-api is at maven's target folder, which might
not be there all the time (mvn clean)
3. If I don't do "mvn test" first, applicaitonContext-test.xml cannot
be found.

I don't understand the following: in "Run configuration" there's
Bootstrap Entries and User Entries. What's the difference? In "User
Entries" there's "Maven Dependencies". Shouldn't this be enough for my
tests to access persistance-api-1.0.jar?

Is there any complete (even the simplest one) example showing how to
test JPA-Spring-Struts2? I don't believe that nobody wrote something
about this - at last all these technologies and combination of those
are mainstream - not some exotic combination.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Joakim Ohlrogge" <joakim.ohlrogge@...>
wrote:
>
> Just a longshot, I have not done any JPA-development myself but it
> looks like you have a different version of the javax.persistance
> API:s when you run eclipse than when you run in maven. Based on that
> assumption my guess is that you are using a different java-version in
> eclipse than in maven. Ie, eclipse runs with java 1.6 and maven runs
> with java 1.5. (Sometimes API:s make it into the java platform between
> versions that can lead to this kind of conflicts)
>
> In eclipse you can check your launch for junit to see which jre is used.
>
> It could also be the order of jar-files on your classpath. In that
> case it's also possible to change the order of the jar-files in the
> properties for your project. Make sure the order matches your pom.
>
> Just some things to check, could help...
>
